thread.title: First 'Jessica Jones' trailer takes Marvel to a dark place
thread.title_full: First 'Jessica Jones' trailer takes Marvel to a dark place

author: Meredith Woerner
title: First 'Jessica Jones' trailer takes Marvel to a dark place
text:
First 'Jessica Jones' trailer takes Marvel to a dark place 'Jessica Jones' trailer 
The first trailer for "Jessica Jones" from Marvel and Netflix. 
The first trailer for "Jessica Jones" from Marvel and Netflix. Meredith Woerner Contact Reporter 
The first trailer for "Jessica Jones" has finally dropped, introducing an entirely new world to the Marvel Universe: grim reality. 
Based on the comics by Brian Michael Bendis, "Jessica Jones" follows the journey of a retired superhero. Krysten Ritter plays the former "Jewel," who hangs up her cape after a very vile and dangerous run-in with villain Zebediah Killgrave, a.k.a. the Purple Man (not the violet hue throughout the new trailer). 
SIGN UP for the free Indie Focus movies newsletter >> 
Played by David Tennant, Killgrave has the power to make people do whatever he wishes, making him sadistic and dangerous. Also in this trailer is Mike Colter, who plays superhero (and future love interest of Jessica Jones) Luke Cage. 
The pilot premiered at New York Comic Con to pretty stellar reviews, with a hint of shock. The series is not for children and will delve into exceedingly adult issues, but that's kind of the point. So it's very interesting to see Marvel, whose television and movie offerings have been handed to the public mostly with a nod and a wink, turn an eye toward reality. 
"Jessica Jones" is set to premiere on Netflix on Nov. 20.
